title: Fall Foods
subtle: Concept (nonfiction), 56 words, Level C (Grade K), Lexile 170L
description: What’s good to eat in the fall? In Fall Foods, students will read about the different types of foods that become ripe in the fall. Students will have the opportunity to compare and contrast foods as well as to ask and answer questions as they read. Detailed, supportive photographs, high-frequency words, and repetitive phrases provide support for beginning readers.
meta: apples, beets, cabbages, fall, foods, pears, potatoes, pumpkins, ripe
Ask and answer questions to understand text
Compare and Contrast : Compare and Contrast
Initial and Final Sounds : Discriminate initial consonant /p/ sound
High-Frequency Words : Recognize and use high-frequency word them

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
